intro: Fimbristylis lithophila, commonly known as the rock sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or inland areas with well-drained conditions. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of pale green to brownish flowers. Fimbristylis lithophila is adapted to thrive in harsh environments, making it a resilient species in arid or semi-arid regions. Its ecological role includes stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
